title: For Windows users: "OpenType Explorer" code from XAML programmer Bátorfi Zsolt
content:
I just found this recently. [Bátorfi Zsolt](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203084210/http:/batorfizsolt.spaces.live.com/default.aspx) posts [this XAML code](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203084210/http:/batorfizsolt.spaces.live.com/Blog/cns!78E216F5ABAE195D!119.entry) that you can paste into XAMLPad or better yet Robby Ingebretsen's [Kaxaml](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203084210/http:/kaxaml.com/) and use to see OpenType features at work. The XAML code can be modified and expanded to change or add fonts or features.

You'll need Windows for this, preferably the 7 beta or Vista, but alternately XP with the .NET 3.0 or 3.5 framework installed.
author: johnbutler

comments.content: Thanks for this, John. I hadn't seen Kaxaml before, but am very pleased to have it.
Thanks John, thats pretty cool stuff.
